edu.kennesaw.cs4850.database

Interface IView

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ClaimView, CoveredItemView, DBView, PolicyView, RegisteredUserView, StatisticsView, TestView, TransView, UserProfileView

    public interface IView
    All views should implement this interface for basic view statements. Documentation for most methods are documented under DBView.
    Author:
    Paul

    • Method Detail

      • Select

        DBView.RetCode Select(int nFields)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        Select(int)

        A select statement against the database table to retrieve data. This is a quicker overloaded method of Select(String). To use this function, the table record needs to be loaded with primary key data. The nField parameter builds a query based on the primary key data.

        Usage Example:

        ClaimView CV = new ClaimView(db); // New ClaimView object.
        CV.record.claim_guid = "F5A10ECD-E927-4638-88FD-3E28311B57B0"; // Load a GUID to be searched.
        CV.Select(1); //'SELECT * FROM claim WHERE claim_guid = '"F5A10ECD-E927-4638-88FD-3E28311B57B0"';
        .
        .
        .


        Parameters:
        nFields - The number of fields to perform the query on from the loaded record.
        Returns:
        The RetCode of the query.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - A general SQL Exception.

      • Select

        DBView.RetCode Select(int nFields,
                    short sortField,
                    long sortOption)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        Select(int, short, long) A select method that extends the ability of the Select(int) method with sorting options. See Select(int) method for additional documentation.
        Parameters:
        nFields - The number of fields to perform the query on from the loaded record.
        sortField - The column the table would sort by.
        sortOption - The bit flag for the option sort. SORT_DESC or SORT_ASC.
        Returns:
        The RetCode of the query.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - A general SQL Exception.
        See Also:
        Select(int)

      • Select

        DBView.RetCode Select(java.lang.String sQuery)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        Select(String) A select method that uses a raw string as the query parameters. This method is not setup to utilize joins and any join processing logic should be handled with code using additional views.
        Parameters:
        sQuery - The SELECT string the query will be performed with.
        Returns:
        The RetCode of the query
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - A general SQL Exception.
